subject: Re: Debian Beryl on Asus A6B
body:
You're right, my mistake!
I usually answer to debian-lists, today I was answering two mail
contemporarly and I got distracted.

byez,
joy

On 6/22/07, $B'!','R'Q'b'Q(B  wrote:
> On Fri, Jun 22, 2007 at 10:50:43AM +0200, JoY$B!x(BTiCk ... wrote:
> > Hi,
>
> ============================================================================
> > On 6/21/07, $B'!','R'Q'b'Q(B  wrote:
> > >> I am using debian 4.0r0 and I want to run Beryl on my computer. When I
> > >start
> > >> Beryl, system make a splash and beryl manager was stopped autamatically.
> > >My
> > >> Firend is able to run beryl on ubuntu 7.04. How I solve this problem, is
> > >> theer anyone who had same problem?
> ===============================================================================
> I haven't written that. :) Please, reply to a list.
> > you may try to launch beryl-manager from shell to see the output, that
> > will tell you what's the problem so you can solve it, otherwise if
> > you're not able to do anything about that you could post it here so
> > someone may have a clue. Just saying: ...make a splash and stop...
> > it's a little to much vague, could be any problem!
> >
> > IMHO it's just some problem with xorg configuration, or maybe with
> > your graphic card, let the output give you a hint ;-)
> > bye,
> > joy
> > --
> > GnuPG key on http://keyserver.veridis.com:11371 KeyID 0x399ED0F6
>
> --
> I'm a gambler
> And I'm a runner.
> But you knew it
> when you laid down.
> I'm a picture
> of ugly stories.
> I'm a killer and I'm a clown.
> (Alice Cooper)
>


--
